main.name: Shivang Charan
main.bio: Hi! My name is Shivang Charan. I will be graduating from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign in 2022 with a B.S. in Computer Engineering. My interests include soccer, cooking, and global travel.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: • Engineered full-stack project for the ePick support application to reduce incident resolution time by up to 25%
work.description2: • Built REST APIs in Kotlin to perform operations such as query from MongoDB, transform data objects, and call other APIs
work.description3: • Designed backend API tests using Groovy to increase project test coverage by 2% and utilized Kubernetes to deploy code
work.description4: • Created frontend interface in Typescript and React to let team members easily view all ePick configs and ePick available work

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: • Developed modem simulator features to decrease dependency on physical modems and reduce project lead times by up to 10%
work.description2: • Crafted software that mocked indications, requests, and responses to simulate entire IMS registration procedure
work.description3: • Revamped modem simulator and new hire documentation to streamline Android Telephony team onboarding process
work.description4: • Wrote modem simulator frontend in Python, backend in C, and implemented bindings to deliver customizable virtual modem

work.title: Software Engineering Intern
work.description: • Collaborated with CIO, Web, and Marketing teams to design functionality and user interface of 2 iOS mobile applications
work.description2: • Programmed applications using XCode and Swift and utilized MySQL databases to allow for dynamic content delivery
work.description3: • Implemented cellular location services to assist transplant centers in better anticipating the arrival of bone marrow couriers
